examples: countermand that order

chineseMeaning: adj.过高的;过分的;不合法的;
examples: The price of food here is exorbitant.
That hotel charges exorbitant prices.
You should be sensible and not make exorbitant demands.

chineseMeaning: adj. 广阔的;滔滔不绝的;健谈的
examples: Birdsong's answer was expansive.
After he'd had a few drinks, Charles became very expansive.
Today Sarah became jovial and expansive.
Expansive persons found him a little dry.
They equipped themselves for the expedition.
They planned to organize a scientific expedition.
He is the commander of the expedition.
The expedition suffered all the rigors of a Canadian winter.
The mail is conveyed with expedition.
We strived to work with great expedition.
Our holidays expire next week.
My passport is due to expire in two months.
When does your driving licence expire?
My credit card will expire in June.
We expire used air from our lungs.

chineseMeaning: adj. 笨拙的;粗鲁的;不善交际的;
examples: He now seems gauche and uninteresting.
He's rather gauche; he hasn't found his feet socially yet.
I find him terribly gauche.

chineseMeaning: n. 测量标准 口径
examples: The fuel gauges dropped swiftly.

The gauge of the barrel was about 2 inches wide.
Her genial smile made every guest feel at home.
The Nankun Mountain with a genial climate is an ideal holiday resort.

I followed the road down past the piles of lumber.
Iron mined in order to topple trees for lumber.
They slapped together a cabin out of old lumber.
Among the sawmill customers are the chair factory and other users of cut lumber.

chineseMeaning: v. 突然倾斜;蹒跚地走
examples: Suddenly the horse lurched to one side and the child fell off.
The man lurched drunkenly out of the pub.
Are the cultured pearls as lustrous and beautiful as the natural ones?
Cadmium is a lustrous, silver-white, ductile, very malleable metal.
The moon was above, lustrous and serene.

chineseMeaning: n. 莫名的不安;身体不适;
examples: The country is laden with economic and political malaise.

Usually it begins with fever, poor appetite, malaise and sore throat.
He was bespattered by malicious gossip .
This malicious and unprovoked attack astounded him.
You ought to kick back at such malicious slander.
The girl's reputation was defiled by malicious gossips.
We were  told by her doctor that she was malingering.

chineseMeaning: n. 坏血病 下流的;卑鄙的;
examples: The crew remained free from scurvy.
Vitamin C, found in citrus fruits, prevents scurvy.

chineseMeaning: adj. 与世隔绝的;隐蔽的;僻静的
examples: The idiom is used to describe a secluded and peaceful utopia.
He remains secluded in his room.
He decided to live a secluded life after retirement.
Sergeant Pond is a secluded, tree-ringed, spring-fed oasis.
This is the quietest and most secluded area of the city.
A sedate color scheme calls for an obvious place for the eye to rest.

chineseMeaning: v. 摇尾巴 摇头 逃学 饶舌 离别
examples: Dogs wag their tails when they are pleased.
The dog's tail wagged.
They often persuaded me to wag school.
The news set tongues wagging.
His silvery tongue began to wag.
There was a faraway hint of wanderlust in his expression.
This phenomenon,sometimes called wanderlust,

His judgement was warped by self-interest.
